turns.speaker: user
turns.utterance: I'm looking for a new pair of noise-cancelling headphones. I've browsed a bunch of sites, but I'm just overwhelmed with options. Can you help me narrow it down?

turns.speaker: agent
turns.utterance: Certainly! To give you the best recommendations, could you tell me a bit more about your needs? What's your budget, what will you primarily use them for (e.g., travel, work, gym), and do you have a preference for over-ear or in-ear headphones?

turns.speaker: user
turns.utterance: Okay, budget is around $200, mostly for travel and working in a noisy coffee shop. I definitely prefer over-ear headphones for comfort. Also, good call quality for calls is important. Now, here's a tough one... what if I lose them? Are there headphones with a tracking feature, or do you offer some kind of insurance on electronics?

turns.speaker: agent
turns.utterance: Thanks for the details! Based on your preferences, I recommend checking out the Sony WH-CH720N and the Anker Soundcore Life Q30. Both are well within your budget, offer excellent noise cancellation and call quality, and are over-ear. Regarding your concern about losing them, some headphones, like certain models from Apple and Tile, have built-in tracking features. While we don't directly offer insurance on electronics, you may be able to add product protection through a third party like Asurion or Upsie. I hope that helps!
